TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit DirectMessages extends CoreTweet.Core._Tokens

Docs.summary: GET/POST direct_messages These endpoints require an access token with RWD permissions.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance class CoreTweet.DirectMessage Destroy(class System.Linq.Expressions.Expression`1<class System.Func`2<string, object>>[] parameters) cil managed

summary.para: Destroys the direct message specified in the required ID parameter. The authenticating user must be the recipient of the specified direct message.
This method requires an access token with RWD (read, write and direct message) permissions.
: The ID of the direct message to delete.
: The entities node will not be included when set to false.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance class CoreTweet.DirectMessage New(class System.Linq.Expressions.Expression`1<class System.Func`2<string, object>>[] parameters) cil managed

summary.para: Sends a new direct message to the specified user from the authenticating user. Requires both the user and text parameters and must be a POST. Returns the sent message in the requested format if successful.
This method requires an access token with RWD (read, write and direct message) permissions.
Note: One of user_id or screen_name are required.
: The ID of the user who should receive the direct message. Helpful for disambiguating when a valid user ID is also a valid screen name.
: The screen name of the user who should receive the direct message. Helpful for disambiguating when a valid screen name is also a user ID.
: The text of your direct message. Be sure to URL encode as necessary, and keep the message under 140 characters.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance class System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable`1<class CoreTweet.DirectMessage> Sent(class System.Linq.Expressions.Expression`1<class System.Func`2<string, object>>[] parameters) cil managed

.method public hidebysig instance class System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable`1<class CoreTweet.DirectMessage> Show(class System.Linq.Expressions.Expression`1<class System.Func`2<string, object>>[] parameters) cil managed

summary.para: Returns a single direct message, specified by an id parameter. Like the /1.1/direct_messages.format request, this method will include the user objects of the sender and recipient.
This method requires an access token with RWD (read, write and direct message) permissions.
: The ID of the direct message.
